sub_title: Senior Research Monitoring & Evaluation Adviser at Rutgers - For sexual and reproductive health and rights
summary:
I am a research, monitoring and evaluation specialist who is passionate about ensuring that under-heard voices are meaningfully heard in research and by practitioners and decision makers. I have over 15 years' experience in government- and NGO-based roles focusing on social exclusion. My areas of experience include youth participation, sexual and reproductive health and rights, homelessness, criminal justice, welfare, gender issues and service user involvement. My proven skills include academic, participatory and policy-focused research; monitoring and evaluation; political influencing; strategic planning; Theory of Change; stakeholder relationship development; programme and project management; fundraising and funder reporting.

I'm also a coach, providing spaces for people to find their inner spark, to find creative solutions to challenges in their lives and to find ways to be true to their values and live more fulfilled lives. I provide sessions online or in person in the Amsterdam area.

company.name: Rutgers - For sexual and reproductive health and rights

profile_positions.company: Rutgers - For sexual and reproductive health and rights
profile_positions.description: Coordinating PMELR (Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation, Learning and Research) in Right Here Right Now 2, a global strategic partnership advocating for youth sexual and reproductive health and rights in 10 countries in Asia and Africa
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Monitoring & Evaluation Adviser

profile_positions.company: Rutgers - For sexual and reproductive health and rights
profile_positions.description:
Explore4Action
- Deputy Project Lead for Explore4Action, a research programme investigating the formation of gender attitudes and norms in early adolescence (12-15 yrs) in Indonesia, how these affect sexual and reproductive health and wellbeing over time; and the impact of comprehensive sexuality education. https://www.rutgers.international/programmes/explore4action
- Lead for Youth Voices: a participatory, qualitative study exploring young people’s experiences, concerns, feelings and meanings about sexual and reproductive health. 
- Support the other two research tracks: (i) the Indonesian arm of the Global Early Adolescent Study, a longitudinal quantitative study exploring gender socialisation and its impact on health and wellbeing over time (http://www.geastudy.org/) and (ii) implementation research to identify determinants of the succesful implementation and scale-up of comprehensive sexuality education.

Hello I Am 
Research, monitoring and evaluation lead for Hello I Am, programme in Bangladesh tackling child marriage in Bangladesh. Responsiblities include:
- Supporting local staff in programme monitoring and reporting
- Designing and managing evaluations
- Managing Positive Deviance pilot, exploring community-identified solutions to child marriage

Standing Strong Together
- Coordinating research in Senegal and Uganda to inform values-based campaigns

profile_positions.title: Empowerment Coach

profile_positions.description: Monitoring, evaluation and learning (MEL) support to Empower Youth for Work programme including supporting country MEL teams and organising large global learning event in Thailand. Effectively stepped in at short notice to cover staff absence.
profile_positions.title: Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning Specialist (interim)

company.name: Rutgers - For sexual and reproductive health and rights

profile_positions.company: Rutgers - For sexual and reproductive health and rights
profile_positions.description:
- Research and PMEL (planning, monitoring, evaluation and learning) in the International Programmes department (fixed term six month contract)
- Focused on two projects, one on child marriage in Bangladesh and another on the whole school approach to comprehensive sexuality education in Africa and Asia
- Commissioned and oversaw completion of baseline study including reporting to funder
- Supported programme development including co-facilitation of workshops with partners in Bangladesh
- Led refinement of Theory of Change in collaboration with partner organisations
- Developed monitoring and evaluation framework 
- Developed operational research proposal 
- Support to other projects including survey design, bid writing and research design
profile_positions.title: Research Monitoring and Evaluation Adviser

profile_positions.description:
- Freelance research and policy professional focusing on social welfare issues in an international and UK context
- October - November 2017: Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning Specialist at Oxfam Novib, Netherlands: Support to Empower Youth for Work programme
- January 2017: completed independent evaluation of Youth Leadership Programme 2011-2015 for CHOICE for Youth and Sexuality, Netherlands. Focused on capacity building and advocacy programme working with six youth-led organisations in Africa, Asia and Europe
- January - February 2017: Pro bono support to Aflatoun International, Netherlands, developing monitoring and evaluation framework for new curriculum incorporating sexual and reproductive health and rights
- October 2016 - March 2017: Policy and public affairs advisor to Revolving Doors Agency, UK
profile_positions.title: Freelance Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Research for MSc International Development Studies thesis in partnership with Simavi and the Tropical Institute of Community Health, Great Lakes University of Kisumu (TICH-GLUK) 
- Study on the impact of participation in sexual and reproductive health and rights youth group on social inclusion
- Ten weeks fieldwork in rural Western Kenya using participatory methods
- Research findings used to inform programme development and presented at Meaningful Youth Participation symposium at Oxfam Novib, June 2016 and Share Net Youth Week, September 2016
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Lead responsibility for creation and delivery of an integrated policy, public affairs and research strategy and programme, covering broad range of policy areas including housing, welfare, health, skills and employment

Research achievements
- Commissioned and managed range of policy research projects and evaluations including in house and externally commissioned research. Designed research proposals and methodologies and used a range of research methods
- Collaboration with academic institutions and government departments
- Principle organisational contact for frequent research queries from students, ensuring that ethical considerations are adhered to and resource implications are proportionate

Advocacy achievements
- Demonstrable success in political lobbying, for example securing government funding for a skills training programme for homeless people following publication of research and lobbying activity
- Lead for successful campaign to raise awareness of women’s homelessness, Rebuilding Shattered Lives, co-author of final report and presented findings at FEANTSA European policy conference on homelessness in May 2015
- Presentation of oral evidence to government select committees
- Led development of client involvement in advocacy work, increasing amount of direct contact between politicians and people who are homeless

Management achievements
- Direct management of policy, public affairs and research team, including expanding and restructuring the team to reflect changing organisational need and management through challenging merger process
- Extensive internal liaison in large organisation (1500+ staff, 250+ projects across southern England) with senior management, operational staff and clients. Close working with Chief Executive, Directors and communications and campaigns teams
- Successful management of team budget
profile_positions.title: Policy, Public Affairs and Research Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Lead for Revolving Doors Agency’s policy and influencing work, and policy team management
- Developed and implemented influencing strategy based on clear and powerful policy messages
- Project management of a range of policy and research projects for example: Development of women-specific Financial Analysis Model, leading role model development, research design, coding and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data and writing official report: Counting the Cost: The financial impact of supporting women with multiple needs in the criminal justice system. Document used by the UK government Ministry of Justice to influence policy on women’s prisons
- Responsible for ensuring that the voice of service users was accurately represented in policy and influencing work
- Coordinated and authored regular policy briefings and responses to government consultations
- Built relationships with MPs, peers and senior policymakers across government
- Recruitment and management of junior staff and interns
- Developed successful funding bids including £30k for London-based programme
- Designed and implemented effective monitoring and evaluation systems
profile_positions.title: Policy Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Development and implementation of programme of proactive and reactive policy work.
- Project management of a range of policy projects.
- Responsible for ensuring that the voice of service users is accurately represented in policy and  influencing work 
- Coordination and writing of consultation responses and policy briefings
- Monitoring of relevant political developments and identification of influencing opportunities
- Building relationships with MPs, peers and senior policymakers across government
- Recruitment and management of junior staff and interns
- Development of successful funding bids
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer

company.name: Office of the Third Sector, Cabinet Office

profile_positions.company: Office of the Third Sector, Cabinet Office
profile_positions.description:
- Valuable insight in to the workings of central government
- Worked with Cabinet Office Adviser on Third Sector Innovation to examine the role of the third sector in the personalisation of criminal justice, health and social care and education services
- Coordinated call for evidence, official visits to best practice examples, worked with Advisor to develop recommendations, authored final report, coordinated government response and worked with government departments to implement recommendations
- Wrote briefings and speeches for the Advisor, briefings for Ministers, press releases and website updates regarding the Advisor’s work
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor (secondment)

profile_positions.description:
- Key staff member for national participatory action research programme resulting in pilot projects for offenders with mental health issues. 
- Project managed portfolio of pilot projects across the country including undertaking needs analyses/ feasibility studies and negotiating stakeholder support. 
- Researched and wrote a range of policy and research documents including responses to calls for evidence, needs analyses and literature reviews. 
- Authored two good practice guides to working with young adults with multiple needs, compiled using the views of young adults and professionals: Aiming Higher and Towards a Shared Future 
- Wrote and uploaded website content, designing, writing, compiling and editing newsletters, leaflets and publicity materials
- Planned, designed, organised and spoke at events including launches, seminars and training
profile_positions.title: Senior Development Officer
